item.title: It's Throwing A Null Pointer Exception!
item.dc:creator: @VorargC VorargC
item.description:
@VorargC wrote:

You won't get that error at compile time. It comes when you run your program.

To elaborate a bit on yarmark’s answer…

When you have a reference variable (what you might think of as an object), it can point to an object, or it can point to nothing at all.

When it points to an object, you can access that object’s members–that is, you can call its public methods and access its public member variables.

Foo foo = new Foo();

foo points to a Foo object so you can call foo.bar() , etc.

However, if a reference variable’s value is null, it doesn’t point to an object, so there are no member variabes to access and no methods to call:

Foo foo = null;
foo.bar(); // NullPointerException because foo is null. It doesn’t point to an object

That pretty much explains it, I don’t have time to look through it all, hope that helps…

Read full topic
item.source: It's Throwing A Null Pointer Exception!
